articles.description: Star SA sprinter off to the paddock, but spring path undecided
articles.content:
Local star Gytrash has pulled up in great order from his narrow defeat to Trekking in Saturday’s Group 1 Furphy Goodwood at Morphettville.
Trainer Gordon Richards says the horse will now head to the paddock for a well-earned rest after a terrific campaign.

articles.title: Evander Holyfield's huge admission about Mike Tyson fight - Yahoo Sport Australia
articles.description: The boxing legends have been teasing fans about a trilogy fight.
articles.content:
Evander Holyfield has sent boxing fans into a frenzy after confirming talks are underway for a fight with fellow legend Mike Tyson.
Holyfield, 57, and Tyson, 53, have been teasing fans over recent weeks, both saying theyre coming out of retirement to fight f… [+2794 chars]

articles.title: Haaland picks up where he left off as Dortmund rout Schalke - The World Game
articles.description: Erling Haaland's phenomenal goalscoring form continued as Borussia Dortmund comprehensively defeated Schalke 4-0 in their first game since the Bundesliga was stopped due to the coronavirus pandemic.
articles.content:
Haaland picked up where he left off by scoring the league's first goal, and his 13th in 12 appearances for Dortmund, following a two-month suspension in a Revierderby played out in an empty Signal Iduna Park.
Raphael Guerreiro doubled the hosts lead just bef… [+2932 chars]

articles.author: Cricket Network
articles.title: Cricket set for return to action in Darwin - cricket.com.au
articles.description: The Northern Territory capital's grade competition leading the way with a return to play under strict health guidelines next month
articles.content:
Competitive cricket is set to resume in Australia next month with the Darwin & District Cricket Competition season scheduled to begin on June 6. 
The competition's Premier grade will begin with a T20 tournament over the Queen's Birthday long weekend, bef… [+3109 chars]

articles.title: A whole series at one ground: India on board with bold solution to save Test summer - Fox Sports
articles.description: Virat Kohli and his team will be open to playing the entire Test series against Australia in a ‘bio-secure’ Adelaide Oval, according to a top Indian Cricket Board official.
articles.content:
India are scheduled to play four Tests and three one-day internationals in December and January on a tour reportedly worth A$300 million in broadcast revenue for Cricket Australia (CA).
